p.s: In chapter 24 of the novel The Hate U Give by Angie Thomas the protagonist Starr finds herself in a situation of psychological burden.
The reason for that is the place where Starr is at.
It is the place where her childhood friend Khalil was shot by a police officer.
While Starr stands between many people wichwhich are protesting against the acquittal of One Fifteen this psychological burden is shown as like a repetition of the scene in her head.
Angie Thomas used many narrative tehcniques to show StarrsStarr's trauma in a better way.
In the holewhole scene one can see the scene through StarrsStarr's eyes by using a first personfirst-person narrator.
By using this narrative technique one can also look in StarrsStarr's trauma and the trigger which is given by beeingbeing on the place wherwhere everything happened (ll. 5-7).

All over that Angie Thomas shows StarrsStarr's inner conflict of beeingbeing in the reality or in her traumaticaltraumatic memories, by putting scenes of the shooting from the past between things that happened in the present (ll. 19,21-22).
This inner conflict turns to anger witchwhich results that Starr starts to scream.
Starr is now fully in the present in witchwhich is showing by no more szenesscenes from the past between the present.
